pros: Small Benedictine collage that believes in its proclaimed values.
cons: Being small, hard times require hared decisions.

job_title: Financial Aid Counselor in Duluth, MN
pros: Tuition Remission for Staff and their family
cons: The college does not have enough staff for the current demands of the college, old technology and outdated practices lead to staff doing the job of two people.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Tuition remission for dependents Motivated Coworkers
cons: Pay Demoralized work force No supports for students

pros: The role offers tuition remission and flexibility
cons: Low pay, no room for growth, lack of leadership

review_title: Great place to work; a little lonely during Covid
job_title: Temporary Administrative Assistant in Duluth, MN
pros: People are respectful and helpful, the pay was decent for part time temporary work at a college.
cons: It was a little lonely during Covid, and I only met some colleagues via a computer screen.

pros: Great people and culture, great work-life balance.
Strong educational standards and extracurricular activities
Employees are eligible for free tuition for themselves and to some extent, immediate family. Duluth can be a lovely area to live for outdoor enthusiasts.
cons: Recently the college has faced some challenges and has cut pay, benefits, and staff. Organizational structure is very top heavy.

pros: Great Benefits, Time off, Educational Opportunities, Values
cons: Low pay, no room for growth

review_title: Mid-range college hoping to be more
pros:
Tuition benefits for kids are good.
Emphasis on good teaching; low pressure for major academic output.
Teaching load is manageable, better than others.,
Opportunities to expand within discipline.
Great colleagues in dept & school.
Great sense of tradition and community values.
cons:
Pay lower than other higher ed in area.
Invest in programs selling now, limping ones not helped.
Admin tries hard but can't generate focused momentum.
Little chance to teach your research area, lots of gen ed courses.

pros: Fantastic work environment.  Excellent co-workers.  4 weeks paid vacation.  They allow lots of freedom to explore person interests in the field to find out what can be applied to my responsibilities.  They believe that if I'm doing my job and incorporating technologies that I love, I'll do a better job.
cons: May be limited room for advancement.  Pay is sub standard for the industry but that's more because of the area.  My wife and I wanted to stay near family.  Salaries would be better in a larger city.

review_title: Great school that helps you work while learning
pros: Great school, Great place to learn and grow.
cons: Location: winter is most of the year
